Context:
Program Name: Business Administration – International Business
Code: B161
Credential: Ontario College Advanced Diploma
Duration: 3 years (6 semesters in-class, 2 semesters work experience)
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $4,640.00 *
International Tuition: $17,455.00 **
School: Management
Location: St. James Campus
Experiential Learning: Work Experience (Co-op or Internship) Required
Delivery: On Campus for all semesters (Fall 2023 and Winter 2024)
Program Description: Graduates will be prepared to perform in various international business fields such as finance, sales, marketing, human resources, international market entry and distribution, international trade management, international negotiation, trade research, international marketing, international trade finance, planning, logistics, and legal aspects of international trade.

* Domestic tuition fee for the 2023-2024 and 2024-2025 academic years.
** International tuition fee for the 2023-2024 and 2024-2025 academic years.

Context:
* The program offers knowledge and skills related to international business.
* Students will learn about documents and procedures supporting the movement of products and services in a global supply chain, statutory and regulatory compliance, international payment instruments and options, foreign exchange strategies, and human resource strategies in an international operation.
* George Brown College has partnered with FITT (Forum for International Trade Training) to offer the FITTskills program. FITT is an international trade training and professional certification body that sets standards and designs training programs leading to the Certified International Trade Professional (CITP) designation.
* Students need to follow the process listed on FITT's website and meet all the requirements applicable to them to qualify for any of these designations/certifications.
* This Centre for Business program (B161) is offered with Work Experience, while students without work experience should apply to B131.
* George Brown College's Centre for Business programs have earned international recognition from the Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP).
* The college now has ACBSP accreditation for 14 Centre for Business diplomas, advanced diplomas, and degree programs.
* George Brown is one of only two colleges in Ontario to have earned ACBSP accreditation.
* Students registered in the Centre for Business program are required to bring their own laptops due to the college's Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) initiative. The Library Learning Commons offers open access computers and equipment that can be borrowed on a short-term basis.

Context:
The text is about a Business program at George Brown College. Here are some factual information extracted from the text:

- The program requires completion of two semesters of work experience to graduate, which can be co-op (paid) or internship (unpaid).
- Students are encouraged to pursue self-directed industry work experience opportunities in addition to formal on-the-job work experience.
- George Brown College offers field education opportunities with real-world challenges and clients.
- International students are not eligible for optional co-op arrangements.
- Career opportunities after graduation may include positions as forecasting and replenishment analyst, merchandise assistant, purchasing assistant, purchasing coordinator, logistics coordinator, among others.
- Students need to complete 38 courses: 33 mandatory courses, 2 Business Electives, and 3 General Education Electives, and 2 Work Experience terms.
- Depending on the results of placement tests, students may be required to take COMM 1000 (Introduction to College Communication) or MATH 1027 (Business Math with Remediation) before progressing to other courses, but these do not count toward the 37 courses required for graduation and will result in additional charges.
- The contact email for the Centre for Business is business@georgebrown.ca.

Context:
There are a total of 37 courses required for graduation at the college. General Education courses need to be completed in semesters 4, 5, and 6. Students must finish three General Education courses from at least two categories: Social Sciences (GSSC), Arts and Humanities (GHUM), or Science and Technology (GSCI). If students have failed or dropped courses, they need to make them up before graduating. Some Continuing Education courses can be taken to make up missed classes, but it's important to check with the Business Office staff to ensure they are equivalent to full-time program courses. Students can contact the business office for assistance with any special timetable requirements they may have.

List of General Education courses required:
- Social Sciences (GSSC): Courses not specified in the text
- Arts and Humanities (GHUM): Courses not specified in the text
- Science and Technology (GSCI): Courses not specified in the text

Semester 1:
- BUS 1038: Business Concepts, No prerequisite
- COMM 2000: Communicating Across Contexts, No prerequisite
- COMP 1010: Business Computer Applications I, No prerequisite
- HRM 1008: Fundamentals of HR Management, No prerequisite
- MARK 1020: Principles of Marketing, No prerequisite
- MATH 1008: Math for Business & Management I, No prerequisite

Semester 2:
- ACCT 1036: Principles of Accounting, No prerequisite
- BUS 1040: Project Management, No prerequisite
- COMM 1034: Professional Communications I, COMM 2000 prerequisite

- MGMT 4009: Operations Management, MATH 1008 prerequisite
- STAT 1012: Business Statistics, MATH 1008 prerequisite
- CMMK 1087: Human Skills, No prerequisite
- BUS 1000: Work Experience Prep Course *, COMM 1007 and 3.0 GPA required *This course is mandatory only for students.

Context:
Program Starting Dates and Fees:
- Programs starting in Fall 2023: Service and ancillary fees are listed in the text.
- Programs starting in Fall 2024 and later: Fees are subject to change.

Work Experience Semesters:
- This program includes two work experience semesters.
- The tuition fee does not include the cost of work experience semesters.
- The first Work Experience fee is $500, covering the cost of the Work Experience Preparation course and the first work experience semester.
- An additional fee of $500 is for the second work experience semester.

Financial Assistance:
- This program is approved for OSAP funding.

Admission Requirements:
- Applicants need an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent, with grade 12 English (C or U) and math (C, M or U) or grade 12 English and math (C or U).
- Mature students may take the Admissions Assessment for English and math or upgrade to achieve the required credits.
- Applicants must meet minimum admission requirements but meeting them does not guarantee admission.
- Some college and university credits may qualify for exemptions.

English Language Proficiency:
- Proficiency in English communications is necessary for program success.

Application Process:
- Domestic students apply through Ontario Colleges.
- International students apply through the George Brown College Online Application System and visit the How to Apply page for more information.

Note: Fees and admission requirements are subject to change without notice. Students should verify them with George Brown College.

International students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System.

On-campus information sessions are held regularly for those interested in attending the college. Questions about programs and career options can be answered during these sessions, and attendees will have the opportunity to meet professors and staff. Sign up for an upcoming session.

For domestic admission inquiries, contact the Admissions Office at admissions@georgebrown.ca or visit the Admissions section.

International students should contact one of the international recruitment representatives by booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry on the International Contact Us page.

For financial aid-related inquiries, contact the Financial Aid Office at FinAid@georgebrown.ca or visit the Financial Aid section.

To speak with an Entry Advisor for advice on program options, make an appointment and review these frequently asked questions.

The Centre for Business can be contacted at business@georgebrown.ca or (416) 415-5000 ext. 2160. For inquiries related to the Business Administration – International Business (B131/161) program, contact Philip Eng, Program Co-ordinator, at peng@georgebrown.ca.

Campus tours are offered regularly and classes for this program take place at the School of Management, mainly at 200 King St. E., and 290 Adelaide St. E., Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Sign up for a campus tour today!
